review_and_appreciate:
Review and Appreciate: Did a positive perspective and thinking help you with your worries or anxiety? Find
  The Path.
quote: "I have learned over the years that when one's mind is made up, this diminishes fear." Rosa Parks

step_of_the_day.title:
What can you make up your mind about to help you move forward? Make a decision today about taking action, in
  order to reduce your fear. (Pillars #5, 6, &9)
step_of_the_day.content:
Emotions interfere with good decision making, as well as taking action. They shift control from your cortex,
  the top portion and most evolutionarily advanced, to the lower, and more primitive limbic and midbrain
  regions. When this happens, we are less creative, less flexible in our thinking and more nervous. It is thus
  helpful to make decisions ahead of time, and before the action is to be taken. Under these more neutral
  conditions it's easier to make a more objective and less emotional (and perhaps fearful) decision.

action_step:
Take a look at your week ahead (always a good planning step) and identify something important needing to
  happen. Decide today, a. to take action, b. the details of how you will follow through, and c. how you will
  handle any possible difficulties that might come up. By making a plan ahead of time, by making up your mind
  as to how you will approach these potential issues, the less fearful you will be and the better the outcome.
journal_entry: Write about how fear plays a role in your life, your decision making and your outcomes.
